meta.description: Disallow unnecessary computed property keys in objects and classes

content.introduction:
Disallow unnecessary computed property keys in objects and classes
üîßFixableSome problems reported by this rule are automatically fixable by the--fixcommand lineoption‚ùÑÔ∏èFrozenThis rule is currentlyfrozenand is not accepting feature requests.
Table of ContentsRule DetailsOptionsenforceForClassMembersWhen Not To Use ItVersionResources
It‚Äôs unnecessary to use computed properties with literals such as:
constfoo={["a"]:"b"};1Copy code to clipboard
The code can be rewritten as:
constfoo={"a":"b"};1Copy code to clipboard
content.sub_configuration_introduction:
This rule has an object option:
enforceForClassMembersset tofalsedisables this rule for class members (Defaulttrue).
By default, this rule also checks class declarations and class expressions,
as the default value forenforceForClassMembersistrue.
WhenenforceForClassMembersis set tofalse, the rule will allow unnecessary computed keys inside of class fields, class methods, class getters, and class setters.
